#s40301

SG
I have an older brother who has participated in a cult for 5-6 years.
It is not a death cult, but it 'appears' to be a peaceful cult. So what kind of problem do I have with it?
I mean, it encourages basic goodness in people, all sorta stuff. But at the same time, it is political, specifically against Our True Party, *cough*Socialism*cough*, not treasonous, but only against the party, and you know what kind of danger that entails.
Not only political, it is also anti-science, spreading pseudo-science practices (and news). I know having questions is good, but it seems that he (my brother) only seek what reinforce his beliefs, which is strange, since I can tell that he still possesses a capable mind.
The final problem that I have with this cult, is personal. He was an elite student, loved by our parents, his friends and me (well, there were feuds here and there) before joining the cult. After joining it, his social life turned on its head, most of his friends limited their interactions with him, none of our relatives want to talk about it, our parents have not been successful in talking him out of it (partly because they are not as well-educated, ironically), I have to pick topics carefully before talking to him, else both of our mood going be ruined, his circle is replaced with the like-minded practitioners of the same cult (which I guess he think he is honestly helping), he now has a job, if you can call it a job, employed by the higher ups of the cult for their site (they have pretty good PR, btw), with a salary of a part time job, we no longer hang out due to his 'work' and cult practices take away most of his time, and he's still living with parents while near 30 years old.
At the time he became a part of the cult, I know I should not make excuses, but I was at the end of high school and had to focus on the entrance exams. I do not beat myself over it, but it comes back to remind me from time to time. I wanted to improve my logical reasoning (which no one taught me) and then try to reason with him, but after numerous talks, I'm not sure what to do next, he rejects everything that challenges his cult beliefs, reason and all, he absolutely despises the socialist party in general (I'm also not a big fan of theirs, but mother is very worried if this level of animosity is going to do great harm to him if he display it in public), he honestly thinks that by practicing the cult's practices, he is helping everyone, somehow.
I have one of the cult's books in digital format waiting for my analysis, it's long, but I do not know if I should do it, what if he still reject my opinion? Am I that much of a coward for asking that kind of question?
I do not want to burden anyone, but I do not know how to solve this anymore.

#s40287
Hi RMIT students,

I'm PR executive of Vinasource company. Recently, I have interviewed a PR intern applicant from RMIT. For the sake of the student herself, I will not reveal her name or information. She showed great interest during the interview, even wanted to have the chance to become the official employee of our company in the future. After consideration, I offered her the job, and she seemed to be really happy about that. She confirmed that she would start her work today (Thursday, 9th Feb 2017) at 9AM, but I waited until 10AM and still she didn't show. I called her and she has blocked my number as well as the company's number. I have sent her an email regarding this but I'm not sure if she will read it.

I would like to share the story together with my email to RMIT students, I hope you all can learn something from this and avoid making the same mistake in the future. I always believe RMIT students are parts of the future of Vietnam. Sadly, there's one girl who just proved me wrong. 

Here are the email:
https://scontent.fsgn5-1.fna.fbcdn.net/v/t34.0-12/16651998_10155029210307628_1589626213_n.jpg?oh=298c3da5f2e397c3805e9c8377bd529e&oe=589EEC7E

https://scontent.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t34.0-0/p280x280/16683063_10155029210352628_1775156534_n.jpg?_nc_ad=z-m&oh=bce382db9bd39be1004e00fdcc6c3f3f&oe=589DC8B5

#s36800

SG

Hi!
I don't normally talk about things like this but I'm just too sad and I want to let it out.
As an introvert, I think have quite an amount of friends, but I'm only close to a few selected ones. Well...even though I may sound stupid and selfish for saying this, I feel totally like crap when none of my friends remember my birthday. Maybe you guys won't understand and it's ok. I know you can't expect everyone to remember such thing. However, wouldn't it be better to recieve wishes from your few close ones than those that are your casual friends? That's why I hid my birthday info from my facebook. I don't what I was expecting from that. When the clock stroke midnight, there was no happy birthday wish on my facebook wall or my phone, not even a single text from a friend that I've known most of my life. I should have expected that but I was so sure that those who claim to be close to me would remember my birthday just like how I remember their birthdays without Facebook's notifications. Maybe it was only me who thought we were close, maybe I actually mean nothing to them. I know I'm stupid and selfish and I shouldn't make a big fuss out of it but I couldn't help feeling abandoned. When I was younger I was isolated and bullied which made me suffer a depression and a bad case of low self-esteem. Thus, I'm always afraid that my friends dislike me and I can't fit in anymore. I'm sorry for talking a lot of nonsenses but I just don't know what to think. I've recieved good wishes from my family (and I'm really greatful for that) but my anxiety keeps telling me that everything is not ok.
I'm sorry for bothering you, admins, you can just ignore me and never post this confession. I'm sorry

Let's kick off the new semester with Club Day, where you can meet with all the clubs in RMIT at their booth in Club Day, have a chance to get to know them and even join in ones that you felt connected to. There are also exciting performances from our own talented clubs to keep you entertained and experience their culture. Besides, you can come to Student Council's booth to get more information about SC and the 2016 Election. We'll also giving out free meals with lots of healthy food to cheer you up before drowning yourself in school works and other activities. Don't miss your chance to join a club and get all the fun, see you there!!
Club Day: March 1st, at Sports Hall, Building 10 from 11am - 4pm
Free Lunch: Grass field, Building 8 from 12pm - 3pm
For more information, don't be hesitate to contact us via our fanpage: https://www.facebook.com/rmitvn.sc.sgs/?fref=ts

SG
Admin post giÃºp em!!!  "INTERNATIONAL FINANCE"

Em Ä‘a táº¡ chá»§ confession # s45571, nÃ³i há»™ lÃ²ng em:

Em Ä‘ang cÃ³ tháº¯c máº¯c vá»›i cÃ¢u 5 cá»§a QUIZ 2: 

Mong má»i ngÆ°á»i chá»‰ cho em, CÃ‚U NÃ€Y EM HAY THáº¦Y Äáº¸P TRAI SAI ??

(Sorry chá»— nÃ y em Ä‘á»ƒ English cho dá»… hiá»ƒu)

 Quantity of imports 300
 Foreign currency price of imports 30
 Exchange rate (d/f) 1.50

Calculate the foreign currency and domestic currency values of imports. What will happen if the exchange rate falls to 1.20, assuming that the value of the elasticity of demand for imports is -0.5?

I remember in his question:

A,B,C : the results are  above 10,000 for value of import in domestic and foreign currency
D : None of above

My solution:

Formula in page 82 of textbook:

Change in Q of imports = -0.5x ((1.2*30)/(1.5*30)-1)= 10%
So, new Q import = 300x 1.1= 330

foreign currency value of imports:   330x 30 = 9900
domestic currency values of imports: 330 x 30 x 1.2 = 11,880

Hi everyone,
This semester we are holding the RMIT Charity Chess Tournament to help raise support for children in Mai Am Anh Sang. The tournament will take place on Saturday August 8th 2015.
Currently we are collecting goods to help these children prepare for the new school year, and we would really appreciate your help to make this possible. 
If you have any kind of clothes or stationery for elementary and middle school students (new or old) that you would like to give away, please donate at our marketing booth: 
28-1/8: the North staircase (Opposite High Land Coffee, B1)  
We believe that every donation counts, and we hope you feel thanked for your contribution to the success of this event.

s43755
Saigon

Dear my beloved boyfriend, 

I love you, I do, from the bottom of my heart, I love you so bad. That explains why I choose to step back for you to take other things as priorities of your life. I used to be so confident, I'm that type of girl that people think I have it all. Since I met you, I become a fool :) 
I try to be strong and independent cuz to me you are a very independent and a great man. I never ask for anything that other girls have their boyfriend give them in special days and of course I've never get anything but I never make a demand. Since we are in relationship, I've never experienced a chance of waiting for my man coming to pick me up then ride  me home, wait for me lightening my room and then back home. I'm always the one who take you home and then ride home alone if I cannot stay with you that night :)
I don't remember how many time I cry in silence or in public. Other people out there felt sorry for a girl with fancy dress, high heels but tears run along her face and she acted like there is no one around her because there feeling is not a fuck compared to what she's feeling inside. Then next morning when I come to see you (yes, I, myself, ride to your house) I acted like I'm happy as usual, like nothing had happened with me the night before, I'm Ok and how are you? Do you want me to help you with something? 
Every time I come to you, I always bring something along with me that I think you will need them, maybe food or drink or some paper, but I never experience the same thing :) I hate those bitches who left you when you have no penny left in your pocket, I wanna compensate. What I finally got is your words that day saying I'm a betrayal, your careless behavior, your thinking of me that I'm losing myself and acting like a bitch :) Well, thank you. 

I want to confess that I slept with another guy that night. It's literally a one night stand, but next morning, I'm full of happiness and joyfulness. I feel brand new and I have made up my mind, I got the decision. You lost me, it's maybe a good thing, find some one better until you are 100% ready for a relationship and don't treat her like the way you did to me. Every woman need love and care from no one but the one they love and trust 

Used to be your well-behaved girlfriend :)

HOT JOB offer for university students!!!
Are you looking for a part-time job that offers both a MEANINGFUL learning experience and a HIGH salary?

You're in luck, because Khai Hoan Land's English Club is now recruiting 5 new members: 2 core members and 3 supervisors!

Job description:
Core members (2 available)
+ Build lessons and teach
+ Participate in and contributing ideas to marketing campaigns
+ Participate in the management of the club
Supervisors (3 available): 
+ Help students by answering their questions and correcting their pronunciation
+ Help conduct activities and games 
+ Prepare materials for lessons

Benefits: 
+ Hone your teaching and management skills
+ Gain insights into the operation and management of businesses
+ Enhance your knowledge of real estate
+ Earn a Certificate of Participation as proof of your involvements in the club

Remuneration:
Please note that all successful applicants will be subjected to a one-month trial period before they are officially hired.
+ Fixed salary (for core members only): 1.5 million/month
+ Lecturer: 120k/hour 
+ Supervisors: 50k/hour
Bonuses are considered based on your performance for the month.

Requirements:
+ A minimum IELTS score of 6.5. You may submit your scores of other standardised test if you want them considered.
+ A flexible schedule. You may be called upon anytime during the week,  either for the lessons or club meetings. 
+ Your patience and passion. Your previous involvement in other club activities will also set you apart.
+ Good looks! You need to look presentable because you will be working with professionals in the industry!

If you are interested, submit your CV to Ms Ly at tothicamly90@gmail.com. 

The deadline is 26/05/2015.

Shortlisted applicants will be notified of the date and time of their interview. Only those successful at the interview will be offered a position. Interns need to go through a one-month trial period, during which the club will be evaluating their commitment and capability. It is only after this period that interns are officially hired and hence paid. 

You will work at KHL Training Center, 19-21 Nguyen Thi Thap, Tan Hung Ward, Dist. 7, HCMC. 

If you have any queries, feel free to contact Ms Ly via email or phone at 0915 999 225
We wish to see you very soon!

Dear RMITers!
I am as an RMIT student too, need your attention please! This is the REAL STORY
I have received an information from Vietnamese citizens about a young couple (Nataliia Kelsheva and Sergiy Kelshev), photographers from Mariupol who came to Vietnam for taking pictures of beautiful landscapes of Nha Trang. While driving to another place for photo shooting Sergiy Kelshev got into a terrible road accident during the photoshooting in Vietnam on March 26 2015. He was hit by a lorry and dragged on a bumper for 40meters. His leg bones were crashed, back muscles 4 cm worn;he got 4 pelvic fractures, bladder and intestines rupture. Doctors from 3 Vietnamese hospitals were fighting for his life, however due to bad conditions his state has only got worse. After being examined by doctors from international clinic decision was made to take Sergiy to a Bumrungrad hospital in Bangkok. Vietnamiese citizens of Ho Chi Minh, Vung Tau and Nha Trang firstly knew about this situation and started to raise funds.There are several complex surgeries ahead and a long way till his full recovery. Sergiy and his family need both psychological and financial support and any help. Many photographers,travelers,journalists and simply kind people have helped Sergiy. Surgeries and therapy will cost thousands of dollars. Please HELP! We rely on your kindness! Please don't be indifferent! Even a small donation can save his life. Please, repost this article. Hi RMIT friends,

You are invited to the very first Microsoft Student Partners Vietnam (MSP) and RMITers meetup next Wednesday (8/4/2015) from 2PM-4PM.

This is the start of the new journey of MSP and RMITers, which will involve a lot of activities (experience, knowledge & IT skills sharing related) in the future. MSPs are friends from many different majors, from many universities in HCMC.

s40394
[SG]
Joining a Networking event again, and I feel extremely bored. No improvements!

Organizers said it would start at 9:00am, but in fact, it's 9:30! Ok, I understand that you need some backup time. But at least you should have some warm up or icebreaking activities during this time! Organizers wasted my 30 mins for waiting!

During the event, organizers let guest speakers answer students' questions. They called it questions & answer: people sat quietly, asking questions turn on turn, and waiting for guest speakers answering turn on turn as well. What kind of networking is this? I don't want to have another lecture! And they spent 2 hours for this section. Holy god!  Only one-on-one! Why do I have to wait others till I ask my questions? I'm a selfish guy, & I don't wanna wait!

Tea break only last for 15 mins! They should have focused on this section. Instead of Q&A, students can talk to whoever they like. And guest speakers can also get to know each other. That's how networking should be!

To Finance Club: This is not the first time you guys organize this type of event. Please improve it! Don't keep damaging your reputation.

Chao cac ban!

De chuan bi cho ngay 20/11 sap toi, Teacher's Day event da bat dau khoi dong, khau chuan bi da hoan tat va sap di vao nhung hoat dong chinh.

Ngay mai, 5/11 Booth cho Teacher's Day se bat dau hoat dong o Northstair vao week 4 va Canoby vao week 5, ngoai nhung hoat dong chinh nhu la ban badge, vong tay, nhom tui minh con co them cac tro choi khac nham tao khong khi vui tuoi cho hoat dong lan nay. Ben canh do, cac ban co the su suc minh voi viec tham gia vao POSTER COMPETITION, day la hoat dong day y nghia va se tao tinh canh tranh cho cac ban. Chung minh se co phan thuong xung dang cho nguoi thang cuoc.!!!!! 
Cac ban co the den booth va dang ki tham gia hoac dang ki online (moi thong tin chi tiet cac ban co the den booth va tim hieu them)

Rat mong nhan duoc su ung ho cua tat ca cac ban!

RMIT Business Club is running a seminar called Insights of Beauty Industry which will be delivered by L'oreal Product Manager, Ms. Tran Nguyen Tuong Vi. The purpose of this seminar is to:
Give students an insight of this blooming industry through the inspiring stories of L'oreal, one of the world-leading beauty firms 
Analyse the Marketing Strategies, Product research and innovation in the beauty industry
Provide information regarding career opportunities and qualifications in the beauty industry
You may have known that the Beauty Industry has grown rapidly all around the world, including Vietnam. There are a lot of opportunities to develop in this industry. Many people and companies walking on this road continue to reap more success day by day.

Therefore, I strongly recommend that you attend this beneficial seminar to get more information about this blooming industry.
 
Date: 25/8/2014
Time: 1pm â€“ 3pm
Venue: 1.2.21
Guest Speaker: Ms. Tran Nguyen Tuong Vi - Product manager of Vichy (RMIT Alumni)

[SG]
California Fitness & Yoga Centers Internship

CFYC is launching an internship for up to four students focused on digital marketing for students majoring in or having experience in
-        Marketing 
-        Digital / graphic design
-        Web design / programing 
-        Content creator (content & article creation)
Description
Students will work at CFYC head office directly with the digital marketing team learning valuable skills and gaining valuable real world work experience at one of Vietnam's top performing and famous companies.
You will learn about and contribute work to digital marketing campaigns for various CFYC companies including gyms, retail fashion, modeling agency, celebrity management, events management, television production and partner companies among others.
Requirements

Currently enrolled in university or recently graduated & able to commit for 6 months â€“ full time/part time (semi flexible schedule)
Everything in your application must be completed in English.

Marketing 
- CV 
- Any previous projects
- 1 minute video telling us about you
(upload to youtube â€“ include link in application)

Graphic / Digital Design
- CV
- Portfolio
- Any previous projects

Content Creator
- CV
- Portfolio
- Any previous projects

Web design / programing 
- CV
- Portfolio
- Any previous projects

Note: "Any previous projects" means anything you were involved in (NOT a school assignment, event or club). Surprise us, we want to see something you contribute work to in the past.
Opportunities
- Work at one of the top companies in Vietnam.
- Have autonomy and freedom for creativity. 
- Work with a professional graphic design teams.
- Great working environment.
- Free gym membership at CFYC.
- Invitation to all CFYC events.
- Create content about celebrities, lifestyle, entertainment and other trendy topics.
- Have the opportunity to meet and work with many of the top celebrities for creating articles including (Ho Ngoc Ha, Xuan Lan, Ho Vinh Khoa and everyone else).
- People are our most valuable assets. There will be the possibility of full time employment for the right candidates after internship completion. 

How to apply: Email to intern.cfyc@gmail.com

Hi guys,
We are from the Accounting Club and in this semester, we are holding an event called AIM Project.
As you may know, "Accounting Incredible Mentor" (AIM) is a project with the aim of supporting and mentoring all students of the "Accounting in Organizations and Society" course. 

This is a very useful activity hold every semester and that has helped students achieved good results in that course.

To repair for this upcoming event, we are now recruiting 7 mentors, 5 program members and 3 marketing members. 

Benefit:

_Impress your CV

_Receive a Certification with Mark Wheaton's signature (Head of Accountancy Department) 

_Enhance team work and communication skill

Link for Registration https://docs.google.com/a/rmit.edu.vn/forms/d/1VOKZhSmcauYb58Ws2REGGcumFWGLwHuwEpGZXJwJVE8/viewform?usp=send_form

If your have any concerns, please contact a.Binh (Project Leader)
Phone number: 0936563457
Email: s3372798@rmit.edu.vn
FB page: www.facebook.com/aim.acct
Or: https://www.facebook.com/RMIT.AccountingClub
Sign in - Google Accounts

Dear RMITers,

Do you love fitness and exercise? Do you want to experience a unique fitness challenge racing against the clock and your peers? 

Join us for the annual RMIT Fitness Challenge 2014 on Saturday, 05 July 2014.  This fun and challenging event will test your speed, strength, endurance, agility and balance as you race through obstacles for a unique fitness experience on campus!  

This year we are introducing individual AND team categories! For team registration, simply enter a male OR female team of 5 (no mixed) along with a team name. (all team members must be copied in sign-up email for online registration). 

Register for FREE at the Sports and Recreation reception (ground floor building 10) or complete the attached form and email to sgs.rec.bookings@rmit.edu.vn by 02 July 2014. 

The event is proudly sponsored by Nutrifort Fitness and we welcome registration from RMIT students, staff and alumni. 

For further information, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Note: Once registered, (either by direct or online registration), BIBs must be collected NO LATER THAN 02 JULY 2014. (Late bib collection may result in disqualification from the event).

[SG] Attention guys!!!!!! RMIT Vietnam Game Club is coming back!!!!!

How was your first week after a long holiday? It's not easy at all, is it?. Therefore, to motivate you begin your semester, we, RMIT Vietnam Game Club want to invite all of you guys to our " PES Tournament 2014"!!!.
+This event will be held on Friday, 20th June 2014 at Outdoor Basketball Court.

_ So, how can you join in this event?
Tomorrow, Thursday, June 19th 2014, the "Club Day", Come to our booth - on the left side of the stage - to register for the game, there will be many other video games for you to play there too ~ (>^w^)> <3 <3 ~  

That is all about our event, if you have any question, please contact to Mr Nguyen Hung Phuong - 0963148977 to have more information. See you guys later and have a good semester <3 <3 <3 Enjoy~

more STRATEGIC? more VISIONARY? more SUCCESSFUL?

If these words describe what you want to achieve in your student life at RMIT, RMIT Vietnam Student Council (RVSC) is an ideal place for you to make your goals come true.

RVSC offers you a chance to work in a nation-wide organisations with tons of opportunities to not only develop RMIT in general but also develop yourself by sharping many personal skills such as communication skill, management skill and last but not least networking skill. I'm from RMIT SGS Design Club. We are going to have a workshop about story writing so would you please help us announce this piece of information below on Confession page. We really appreciate your help. Thank you in advance.

--------------------------------------
[SGS]

[Design Club]

"After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world." â€• Philip Pullman

Everyone loves stories and they just make our life more diversified and more beautiful. Yet, have you ever thought of writing your own stories? Design Club is going to organise the very first workshop in the series of Creative Writing next Saturday afternoon from 3pm to 5pm on Grass Field. This is an exclusive chance for you to start your first story and may even get it published. Anyone who has a passionate interest in writing is welcome.

Don't hesitate to register now by filling in the form: http://bit.ly/CreativeWritingRegistration

Hello everyone, we're planning to open a new sport club. Running club, will be officially operated in the first semester of the year 2014. Currently, there are about 30 people that joined the club. This includes RMIT lecturers and other people who are interested in running. Club will provide courses that will help training member to a professional runner, start from the basics. So members don't need to worry about being too weak or too tired when participate in running. The aim of the club is too improve diligence, strong wills, and vigor that will help you to achieve other things in life. The expected club fees are from 40 000 -> 60 000 VND.

"PROPOSED RMIT RUNNING CLUB
We've planning to open a running club next semester. Thereforce, we would like to invite you who love running to show your interest, then we will apply to RMIT to open this club and invite you to join.

The main aim of this club is to give the members opportubities to challenge themselves by participating in competitions and overcoming their limit.

There are many exciting activities in the club:
    Running for health:
We will organize short running sessions in the morning and in the evening in Sai Gon South Campus.
    Running for competitions:
We will introduce you to races in Vietnam and assist you in training
   Races including:
â€¢ 3km, 5km and fun run
â€¢ 10km
â€¢ half-marathon(21km)
â€¢ full-marathon(42km)
â€¢ ultra-marathon(over 70km)
â€¢ half-triathlon(1.8km swim, 62km bike, 12km run)
â€¢ ironman triathlon(3.6km swim, 180km bike, 42km run)(overseas, future plan)
â€¢ duathlon(6km run, 62km bike, 12km run)
   Training assistance including:
â€¢ running techniques
â€¢ running nutrition
â€¢ how to avoid and manage injury
Please add your name and email address to receive further information.

Dear all
How have you been working this semester, RMITers? We hope you're doing well and will earn fantastic results!
As some of you may already know, C.A.N (Community Action Network Club) usually organizes annual charity events in order to raise funds for underprivileged people. Last semester, we successfully carried out the second Charity Trip and generated 20 million VND, all dedicated to . To continue our charitable mission, this semester, we're glad to present to you another event under a different theme â€“ 'A Little Match Girl'. Our charity destination this time is Thien Duyen Orphanage, which has been sheltered a hundred of disable children. After meticulous research on the nursing home's harsh conditions, we recognized an urgent need for support from others rather than external sponsors solely. Therefore, we're sending you this e-mail to kindly ask for your contribution. Since it's voluntarily based, there's no specific in-kind support required. We're happy to receive any kind of your support. However, we strongly recommend food (rice, instant noodle, milk, confectioneries and cooking oil) and articles of personal care
For more information or donation you can contact Nga Le: 0985 435 269 or visit our Facebook Page at https://www.facebook.com/RMITCAN?fref=ts
Also, here is the link for you to know more about Thien Duyen: http://www.thiennguyen.org/mai-am-thien-duyen-cu-chi/

"[SG] From an alumni, graduated last year and working for nearly 1.5 year now.

First of all, BIG CONGRATZ to all mates who just graduated....enjoy the moments :)

There are some thought and my experience (after 1.5 year working) just want to share.
- To all the graduands: yes, u r just so happy now as you think u just pass a challenge in your life. But trust me, that is no such a thing to compares with WHAT YOU GONNA FACED IN FUTURE. So plz, don't waste too much time and relaxed to long on this academic achieve. If you not yet getting a job, please go out, try to communicate wiith others ( your teachers, your brothers/ sisters' friends or your friends). The more relationship you build, the better you will be....i mean in the positive side ( confidence and the information). You may choose to study higher, yes...it 's Ok...but better to earn life experience first. 

- To other mates who still with RMIT: honestly recommend to build up your CONFIDENCE to speak, to communicate with others (especially properly talk to native English speakers). Our English is of course less than others who have opportunity to study abroad. Hence, don't waste your opportunity and time in RMIT. Practise as much as you can. Wrap them for a coffee, quit chat in E, and if you got enough financial ability, i strongly encourage to go abroad for English improvement.

- We may graduate with High Distinction ( yes i am), but i'm not confidence enough to pick a phone for abroad client. The English they use is usual language, not what we used to write in Report/ assignment. Can you join in party with foreigners and make a joke by using English/ or can u understand other joking? Well, the more you practise, the better you have, much easier for you in working experience.

My Aussie boss has said 1 truth, RMIT VN student may better understand the theory, but who study abroad are better in communication. They can go out and talk, their lives are easier and of course they get more pay. So....choosing sitting at the table for all the documents or going out to talk, connect with suppliers/clients is up to you. ^^

I think it's too long up to now....so thanks for reading....Hope it's useful somehow."

Dear RMIT Potential Financiers,

You dream about becoming a great financial analyst, or may be financial guys who are very smart and creative, achieve unlimited want with limited resources.

The finance world is enormous and you do not know where to start.

After graduate, you want to work for famous financial firms in Viet Nam like VinaCapital, HSBC, Big 4 etc, but you do not know how to do it, what should be preparedâ€¦
Many questions, but you don't know where to find your answerâ€¦

Well we cannot help you find your company or build your career or give you a job. But we give you a tool for you to find your own way:
	ALUMNIT NETWORKING EVENT (ANE) 2013

RMIT Vietnam Finance Club (SGS) would like to invite you to the Alumni Networking Event (ANE), which would be held this Saturday (16th November, 2013).

Date: Saturday of Week 5 (16/11)
Time: 9:30 am to 12pm
Venue: 1.2.21

Hi everyone
Registration for Carnival Day 2013 is available. Pls come to reception at REC to register and collect ticket. Free tickets for RMIT students, staff and alumni. Deadline for registration is 7 Nov. Make sure you collect ticket for games and prizes.
Carnival Day 2013
The biggest annual sports and entertainment festival organised by the Sports & Recreation Department is coming in November. The event is open to all RMIT students, alumni, and staff along with their families. Everyone can join in a variety of creative activities, enjoy diverse performances on stage by fellow staff and students and re-fuel with some light refreshments. Many prizes and F&B vouchers are available for everyone taking part in the games. 
Best regards.

[HN Campus]

RMIT Outing - 2 days 1 night - Mai Chau - Hoa Binh

It's time to plan your semester break!

This is the first time RMIT Student Council â€“ Hanoi campus organizes a 2-day-1-night trip to Mai Chau â€“ Hoa Binh for RMIT community. Whoever you are, an English student, a Diploma or Bachelor student or an alumnus, you are more than welcomed to go to Mai Chau with us.

Mai Chau Valley is set in the stunningly beautiful, mountainous region of Hoa Binh Province, 135km south west of Hanoi. Many of Vietnam's 54 indigenous ethnic minority groups live in the region, making the local Sunday markets colorful place's to be!

With RMIT Student Council â€“ Hanoi campus, this autumn, you will get a chance to cycle across the valley and see the beauties of mountainous Vietnam. Additionally, this autumn will also a memory with your friends, the memory of attending an amazing race, participating in partner matching game and other mini games at Mai Chau. It will be the moment when you can get closer to local people, stay and sleep in stilt houses after having BBQ party and fire camp.

The trip will be taken place on 21st and 22nd September 2013 (Saturday and Sunday of Week 14)

The schedule for 2 days in Mai Chau
Day 1:
Morning: Travel from Hanoi to Mai Chau

Afternoon: Have lunch
The amazing race
The partner matching game
10 Mini games

Evening: Have dinner and BBQ Party
Fire camp

Day 2:
Morning: Have breakfast
Sightseeing

Afternoon: Have lunch
Travel from Mai Chau to Hanoi

Ticket price:
â€¢ 450.000 vnd/person
(for a group more than 5 people)

â€¢ 500.000 vnd/person
(for a group from 1 to 5 people)

Ticket price includes

o 1 Breakfast
o 2 lunch
o 1 dinner
o 1 BBQ party
â€¢ Travel expense
â€¢ Fire camp (Singing, dancing)
â€¢ Games
â€¢ Accommodation

Guys, remember to stop by out non-stress workshop tomorrow, 3h-4h30 at room 1.2.21. Many helpful tips await you there. Good working results always come from a healthy mind don't they????

Dear RMIT students,


After the incredible success of Currency Exchange Seminar, on this Friday, Finance Club will hold another interesting event. Can you guest what it is?

Yes, it is the workshop about Financial Modeling with a special guest speaker from Fgate Center. 
No more basically theory, come and get practical experience!

Warren Buffet, a great financier, has said:"Never depend on single income. Make investment to create a second source". The importance of right investments is undeniable as they provide us with passive income. However, have you ever wondered what a wise investment is and how we can recognize it?

If you are asking yourselves the same question, this workshop is perfect for you. Attending this workshop, you will be able to use financial modeling to evaluate and predict the performance of a financial asset or a company based on past data. Plus, Fgate lecturer will also introduce other useful applications of financial modeling in accounting and quantitative finance. It is a crucial tool that all business students should get used to, especially ones who studying finance and accountancy.

So what are you waiting for? Let's register right now.
https://docs.google.com/a/rmit.edu.vn/forms/d/1IXcdp6xbxuWhVaMv8PRcBwghjVkOfYeWASw7X4oUEgE/viewform

Where: Room 1.2.21 
When: 10am-12pm on this Friday, August 9th.

Besides, don't forget to take part in the mini contest on our Facebook page with questions posted every night. Lots of lovely prizes are waiting for you guys.

See you on Friday.^^
L.
